pub_created_display: Ardashir I (224 to 240), AE/2, Group / Mint D ("Marw")
numismatic_provenance_s: Classical Numismatic Group, Lancaster, PA; 05/26/2004; E90 (111)
issue_place_s: Group / Mint D ("Marw"), Khorasan, Sasanian Empire
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: covered crown cap surmounted by covered korymbos; plain diadem; pendent diadem ribbons; tunica; dotted border; triplet between korymbos and upper ribbons (SNS 1, var. 3)
issue_obverse_legend_s: Unclear; crescent with dot in front of head
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; round altar shaft; four altar slabs; altar flames depicted with vertical strokes; to the left and right mushroom-shaped bases supporting lion-paw structures; below left and right edge of altar table pendent diadem ribbonbelow left and right edge of altar table pendent diadem ribbon; dotted border
issue_reverse_legend_s: Unclear; dot to the left and right of altar shaft (SNS 1, var. 26)
